title: Vivo announces price cut for T3x 5G smartphone: Check new prices, specs - Business Standard
summary:
Vivo announces price cut for T3x 5G smartphone: Check new prices, specs

Publication Date: Not specified
Source: Business Standard

The Vivo T3x 5G smartphone has received a price reduction across all variants, making it more accessible to consumers. The smartphone, launched in April last year, offers enhanced specifications for its new lower prices.

New Prices:

  • 4GB RAM + 128GB storage: Rs 12,499 (was Rs 13,499)
  • 6GB RAM + 128GB storage: Rs 13,999 (was Rs 14,999)
  • 8GB RAM + 128GB storage: Rs 15,499 (was Rs 16,499)

Features:

  • Qualcomm Snapdragon 6 Gen 1 chipset
  • 6.72-inch FHD+ resolution display with 120Hz refresh rate
  • 6000mAh battery with 44W fast charging
  • Dual rear camera: 50MP + 2MP, 8MP front camera
“Vivo highlights the inclusion of its RAM 3.0 technology, enabling up to 8GB of virtual RAM for enhanced multitasking.”

This price cut aims to enhance the smartphone's competitiveness in the growing market.
newTitle: Vivo Cuts Prices for T3x 5G Smartphone

title: Rohit Sharma dropped for SCG Test vs Australia - The Times of India
summary:
Rohit Sharma Dropped for SCG Test Against Australia

Date: Friday
Source: Times of India

Rohit Sharma has been dropped from the Indian cricket team for the Sydney Test against Australia due to his poor recent form.

  • Rohit returned to lead the team after missing the first Test due to the birth of his second child.
  • His return saw changes in batting order that did not yield positive results.
  • Rohit has scored only 31 runs in five innings during the ongoing Border-Gavaskar Trophy.
  • His overall performance in 2024 has been disappointing, with a meager average of 24.76.
  • Jasprit Bumrah is expected to lead the team in this final match of the series.
“Rohit has mustered just 31 runs from five innings at an average of 6.20.”

This decision marks a significant moment in Rohit Sharma's career, as he appears to be moving towards the end of his Test journey.
newTitle: Rohit Sharma Dropped for SCG Test Against Australia

title: How change in diet eased elderly woman's knee pain; doctor shares heartwarming video - The Times of India
summary:
How Change in Diet Eased Elderly Woman's Knee Pain

Publication Date: Not provided Source: Not provided

In a heartwarming post, Dr. Sayajirao Gaikwad shares how dietary changes significantly improved an elderly woman's quality of life by alleviating her knee pain.

  • Protein is crucial for the elderly to combat sarcopenia, which leads to muscle loss.
  • The woman in the video, initially advised for knee replacement, experienced a 75% reduction in pain after modifying her diet.
  • Dr. Gaikwad emphasizes incorporating protein-rich foods like eggs, paneer, meat, and legumes while minimizing rice and wheat.
  • Important protein sources include lentils, chickpeas, and dairy products like Greek yogurt.
“With just putting them on high protein foods we see change in quality of their life. Our elder deserve nutrient dense foods.” — Dr. Sayajirao Gaikwad

This article highlights the importance of dietary adjustments for the elderly, showcasing how a focus on protein can lead to substantial health improvements.
newTitle: How Change in Diet Eased Elderly Woman's Knee Pain

title: Manu Bhaker, Gukesh among four athletes to get Khel Ratna award - The Hindu
summary:
Manu Bhaker, Gukesh among four athletes to get Khel Ratna award

Date: January 02, 2025 Source: The Hindu

The quartet of shooter Manu Bhaker, World Chess Champion D. Gukesh, men's hockey captain Harmanpreet Singh, and para-athlete Praveen Kumar were named recipients of this year's Major Dhyan Chand Khel Ratna Award — the country's highest sporting honour.

  • Manu Bhaker won two medals in the recent Olympics, becoming the first athlete from independent India to achieve this.
  • D. Gukesh became the youngest World Chess Champion and contributed to India's gold in the Chess Olympiad.
  • Harmanpreet Singh led the Indian men's hockey team to a bronze medal in the Olympics.
  • Praveen Kumar was crowned the T64 champion in the Paris Paralympics.
“The awardees will receive their awards from the President of India at a specially organised function at Rashtrapati Bhavan on 17th January, 2025 [Friday] at 1100 hours,” the Sports Ministry said.

This recognition highlights the excellence and achievements of these athletes in their respective sports, showcasing India's emerging sporting talent.
newTitle: Manu Bhaker, Gukesh Among Four Athletes Receivers of Khel Ratna Award

summary:
Manu Bhaker, D Gukesh Among Four Athletes To Get Dhyan Chand Khel Ratna Award: Sports Ministry

Publication Date: December 24, 2024 | Source: NDTV

Double Olympic medallist shooter Manu Bhaker and chess world champion D Gukesh have been awarded the prestigious Dhyan Chand Khel Ratna award by the Sports Ministry, alongside Harmanpreet Singh and Praveen Kumar. The Khel Ratna is the highest sporting honour in India.

  • Manu Bhaker has recently dealt with controversy regarding her nomination, previously causing frustration among her supporters.
  • Bhaker is the first athlete from independent India to win two medals in a single edition of the Olympics.
  • D Gukesh, 18, became the youngest World champion and contributed to India’s historic gold in the Chess Olympiad.
  • Praveen Kumar, para high-jumper, clinched a T64 championship at the Paris Paralympics.
  • Awards will be presented by the President of India on January 17, 2025.
“With regards to ongoing issue for my nomination for the most prestigious Khel Ratna award - my role is to play and perform for my country. Awards keep me motivated but are not my goal.” - Manu Bhaker

This recognition highlights the achievements of athletes who excel despite challenges, fostering motivation among future sportspeople.
newTitle: Manu Bhaker and D Gukesh Among Four Athletes Honored with Khel Ratna Award

title: What’s Switzerland’s ‘Anti-Burqa’ Law That Comes Into Effect From January 1? | Explained - News18
summary:
What’s Switzerland’s ‘Anti-Burqa’ Law That Comes Into Effect From January 1? | Explained

Date: January 02, 2025

Source: News18

From January 1, 2025, Switzerland officially bans burqas, hijabs, and any other face coverings in public spaces, as mandated by a law solidified in 2023 after a 2021 referendum where 51.2% of voters supported the ban.

  • The law includes fines of up to 1,000 francs for violators.
  • Exceptions are made for health-related facial coverings and coverings in places of worship.
  • The proposal was driven by the right-wing Swiss People's Party, citing concerns over extremism.
  • The Muslim population in Switzerland is predominantly from Turkey, Bosnia, and Kosovo, making up about 5% of the total population.
“Today’s decision opens old wounds, further expands the principle of legal inequality, and sends a clear signal of exclusion to the Muslim minority.” - Central Council of Muslims

This law raises significant discussions on women's rights, identity, and the ongoing debate surrounding secularism and multiculturalism in Switzerland.
newTitle: Switzerland's Anti-Burqa Law Explained: What You Need to Know

"If the performance doesn't improve, even Gautam Gambhir's position wouldn't be safe," a senior BCCI official stated.

This situation raises questions about the future of the Indian cricket team under Gambhir as tension mounts ahead of critical tournaments.

title: Space-Comm Expo reveals 2025 space industry trends and challenges - BroadcastProME.com
First meteor shower of 2025 is coming. How to catch the Quadrantids - India Today
summary:
First Meteor Shower of 2025: How to Catch the Quadrantids

Published On: Jan 2, 2025 | Source: India Today

As the new year unfolds, stargazers are in for a treat with the Quadrantid meteor shower, which peaks on January 3-4, 2025. This celestial event marks the first significant meteor shower of the year, offering a dazzling display of fireballs streaking across the night sky.

  • The Quadrantids are a unique meteor shower, originating from the asteroid 2003 EH1.
  • They peak at 60 to 120 meteors per hour under ideal conditions.
  • The meteor shower is visible particularly between 3:00 AM and 5:00 AM local time.
  • Quadrantids typically do not leave long trails but can be bright fireballs.
  • The meteor shower will remain active until January 16, 2025.
Nasa's William Cooke notes that while Quadrantids typically do not leave long trails, their heads can appear as bright fireballs.

Finding a dark location away from city lights is essential for optimal viewing. Minimal moonlight interference offers an excellent opportunity for celestial enthusiasts to enjoy this spectacular event.
newTitle: First Meteor Shower of 2025: How to Catch the Quadrantids

Israeli airstrike kills at least 10 in southern Gaza, medics say - Reuters
summary:
Israeli Airstrike Kills 10 in Southern Gaza, Medics Report

Date: January 2, 2025 | Source: Reuters

The early morning airstrike killed at least 10 Palestinians, including women and children, in a tent encampment intended for displaced families in southern Gaza.

  • The incident occurred in Al-Mawasi, a designated humanitarian area in Khan Younis.
  • Fifteen additional individuals suffered injuries in the strike.
  • Notable figures, including two police department officials, were among the casualties.
  • Israel's military has not provided an immediate comment regarding the attack.
  • Since the outbreak of war, over 45,500 Palestinians have been reported killed according to health officials in Gaza.
“Most of Gaza's 2.3 million people have been displaced, and much of the tiny coastal strip is in ruins.”

This latest airstrike underscores the ongoing humanitarian crisis and violence in the Gaza Strip, where civilian casualties continue to rise significantly amid the conflict.
newTitle: Israeli Airstrike Kills 10 in Southern Gaza, Medics Report

title: Bangladesh court rejects bail plea of Chinmoy Krishna Das - The Hindu
summary:
Bangladesh Court Denies Bail to Chinmoy Krishna Das Amid Protests

Date: January 02, 2025 | Source: The Daily Star

The court in Chattogram has refused to grant bail to Chinmoy Krishna Das, following a hearing with heightened security. This decision comes after significant protests and violence related to his case.

  • The bail request was denied by Judge Md. Saiful Islam after a 30-minute hearing.
  • Chinmoy Krishna Das is facing sedition charges for allegedly raising a saffron flag above the national flag.
  • The protests following his arrest led to violent clashes and the death of a lawyer.
“We will move for Chinmoy in the court for his bail.” – Apurba Kumar Bhattacharjee, lawyer

The ongoing unrest reflects deeper societal tensions and legal challenges within Bangladesh, highlighting the implications of the case on public order and legal proceedings.
newTitle: Bangladesh Court Denies Bail to Chinmoy Krishna Das Amid Protests

title: Bajaj Finance shares jump over 5% as Citi maintains 'Buy' on Q3 optimism, sees up to 17% upside for stock - Moneycontrol
summary:
Bajaj Finance shares jump over 5% as Citi maintains 'Buy' on Q3 optimism, sees up to 17% upside for stock

Date: January 02, 2025 / Source: Moneycontrol

Bajaj Finance share price surged over 5 percent in Thursday's trade after analysts at the brokerage Citi reiterated its 'Buy' rating on the stock. The stock climbed to an intraday high of Rs 7,306.05, marking a 5.34 percent gain from its previous close.

  • Citi has set a price target of Rs 8,150 for Bajaj Finance, indicating a potential upside of 17.51 percent from Wednesday's closing price.
  • The brokerage highlighted expectations of loan growth stability and a positive bias in net interest margins.
  • Key support is coming from segments like mortgage financing and sales financing.
  • A marginal rise in credit costs is estimated between 2.2 to 2.5 percent.
"Key support is coming from segments like mortgage financing, sales financing, and new business ventures," Citi noted in its report.

This positive movement in Bajaj Finance shares aligns with the overall rise in the finance and NBFC sector.
newTitle: Bajaj Finance Shares Surge Over 5% as Citi Maintains 'Buy' Rating
